message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.DC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of minimizing Age-of-Information (AoI) in a multi-hop network with throughput requirements, which is a problem commonly studied in the field of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper also involves optimization and approximation algorithms, which are topics studied in computer science theory (cs.IT). The use of multiple paths in the network and the consideration of batch generation differentiate this study from existing AoI studies, which may fall under the category of systems and control (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the equivalence between minimizing AoI and minimizing maximum delay, which may fall under the category of distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper presents simulation results to validate the proposed approach, which may fall under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) if the simulations involve the use of learning algorithms.
